problems.title: Find the Index of the First Occurrence in a String (String Algorithm)
problems.description:
Problem Statement

Given two strings needle and haystack, return the index of the first occurrence of needle in haystack, or -1 if needle is not part of haystack.

Return the index (0-based) of the first occurrence, or -1 if not found.
problems.examples:
Sample Input
sadbutsad sad

Sample Output
0

Explanation: "sad" occurs at index 0 and 6. The first occurrence is at index 0.

Sample Input
leetcode leeto

Sample Output
-1

Explanation: "leeto" did not occur in "leetcode", so we return -1.
problems.constraints:
1 <= haystack.length, needle.length <= 10^4
haystack and needle consist of only lowercase English characters.
hintsList: Use a sliding window approach to check each position in haystack.
Compare needle with substring of haystack starting at each position.

problems.title: Shortest Palindrome (String Algorithm)
problems.description:
Problem Statement

You are given a string s. You can convert s to a palindrome by adding characters in front of it.
Return the shortest palindrome you can find by performing this transformation.
problems.examples:
Sample Input
aacecaaa

Sample Output
aaacecaaa

Explanation: Add "aa" in front to make it a palindrome.

Sample Input
abcd

Sample Output
dcbabcd

Explanation: Add "dcba" in front to make it a palindrome.
problems.constraints:
0 <= s.length <= 5 * 10^4
s consists of lowercase English letters only.
hintsList: Find the longest palindromic prefix of the string.
Reverse the remaining suffix and add it to the front.

problems.title: Repeated Substring Pattern (String Algorithm)
problems.description:
Problem Statement

Given a string s, check if it can be constructed by taking a substring of it and appending multiple copies of the substring together.

Return "True" if it can be constructed, else "False".
problems.examples:
Sample Input
abab

Sample Output
True

Explanation: It is the substring "ab" twice.

Sample Input
aba

Sample Output
False

Explanation: It cannot be constructed from a repeated substring.

Sample Input
abcabcabcabc

Sample Output
True

Explanation: It is the substring "abc" four times.
problems.constraints:
1 <= s.length <= 10^4
s consists of lowercase English letters.
hintsList: Try all possible substring lengths that divide the string length.
Check if repeating the substring gives the original string.

problems.title: Add Bold Tag in String (String Algorithm)
problems.description: Problem Statement You are given a string s and an array of strings words. You should add a closed pair of bold tag and to wrap the substrings in s that exist in words. If two such substrings overlap, you should wrap them together with only one pair of closed bold-tag. If two substrings wrapped by bold tags are consecutive, you should combine them. Return s after adding the bold tags.
problems.examples: Sample Input abcxyz123 abc 123 Sample Output abcxyz123 Explanation: The two strings of words are substrings of s. Sample Input aaabbb aa b Sample Output aaabbb Explanation: "aa" and "b" overlap and are consecutive, so they are combined.
problems.constraints:
1 <= s.length <= 1000
0 <= words.length <= 100
1 <= words[i].length <= 1000
s and words[i] consist of English letters and digits.
All the values of words are unique.

starterCodes.code:
class Solution:
    def addBoldTag(self, s, words):
        # TODO: Return s with bold tags added
        pass

if __name__ == '__main__':
    import sys
    lines = sys.stdin.read().strip().split('\n')
    s = lines[0]
    words = lines[1].split() if len(lines) > 1 else []
    sol = Solution()
    print(sol.addBoldTag(s, words))

hintsList: Mark all positions where words appear in the string.
Merge overlapping and consecutive marked regions, then add bold tags.

problems.title: Repeated String Match (String Algorithm)
problems.description:
Problem Statement

Given two strings a and b, return the minimum number of times you should repeat string a so that string b is a substring of it. If it is impossible for b to be a substring of a after repeating it, return -1.

Notice: string "abc" repeated 0 times is "", repeated 1 time is "abc" and repeated 2 times is "abcabc".
problems.examples:
Sample Input
abcd cdabcdab

Sample Output
3

Explanation: We return 3 because by repeating a three times "abcdabcdabcd", b is a substring of it.

Sample Input
a aa

Sample Output
2

Explanation: We need to repeat "a" twice to get "aa".
problems.constraints:
1 <= a.length, b.length <= 10^4
a and b consist of lowercase English letters.
hintsList: Calculate the minimum number of repetitions needed based on string lengths.
Check if b is a substring of the repeated string.

problems.title: Rotate String (String Algorithm)
problems.description:
Problem Statement

Given two strings s and goal, return true if and only if s can become goal after some number of shifts on s.
A shift on s consists of moving the leftmost character of s to the rightmost position.

For example, if s = "abcde", then it will be "bcdea" after one shift.

Return "True" if s can become goal, else "False".
problems.examples:
Sample Input
abcde cdeab

Sample Output
True

Explanation: s can become goal after 2 shifts.

Sample Input
abcde abced

Sample Output
False

Explanation: s cannot become goal after any number of shifts.
problems.constraints:
1 <= s.length, goal.length <= 100
s and goal consist of lowercase English letters.
hintsList: Check if goal is a substring of s + s.
Also verify that s and goal have the same length.

problems.title: Camelcase Matching (String Algorithm)
problems.description:
Problem Statement

Given an array of strings queries and a string pattern, return a boolean array answer where answer[i] is true if queries[i] matches pattern, and false otherwise.
A query word queries[i] matches pattern if you can insert lowercase English letters into the pattern so that it equals the query. You may insert a character at any position in pattern or you may choose not to insert any characters at all.

Return a space-separated string of "True" or "False" for each query.
problems.examples:
Sample Input
FooBar FooBarTest FootBall FrameBuffer ForceFeedBack
FB

Sample Output
True False True True False

Explanation: "FooBar" can be generated like this "F" + "oo" + "B" + "ar".

Sample Input
FooBar FooBarTest
FoBa

Sample Output
True False

Explanation: "FooBar" can be generated like this "Fo" + "o" + "Ba" + "r".
problems.constraints:
1 <= pattern.length, queries.length <= 100
1 <= queries[i].length <= 100
queries[i] and pattern consist of English letters.

testCases.input:
FooBar FooBarTest FootBall FrameBuffer ForceFeedBack
FB

starterCodes.code:
class Solution:
    def camelMatch(self, queries, pattern):
        # TODO: Return list of "True" or "False"
        pass

if __name__ == '__main__':
    import sys
    lines = sys.stdin.read().strip().split('\n')
    queries = lines[0].split() if len(lines) > 0 else []
    pattern = lines[1] if len(lines) > 1 else ""
    sol = Solution()
    result = sol.camelMatch(queries, pattern)
    print(' '.join(result))

hintsList: Use two pointers: one for the query and one for the pattern.
Match uppercase letters exactly, and skip lowercase letters in the query.

problems.title: Longest Happy Prefix (String Algorithm)
problems.description:
Problem Statement

A string is called a happy prefix if is a non-empty prefix which is also a suffix (excluding itself).
Given a string s, return the longest happy prefix of s. Return an empty string "" if no such prefix exists.
problems.examples:
Sample Input
level

Sample Output
l

Explanation: s contains 4 prefix excluding itself ("l", "le", "lev", "leve"), and suffix ("l", "el", "vel", "evel"). The largest prefix which is also suffix is given by "l".

Sample Input
ababab

Sample Output
abab

Explanation: "abab" is the largest prefix which is also suffix.
problems.constraints:
1 <= s.length <= 10^5
s contains only lowercase English letters.
hintsList: Use KMP algorithm to compute the longest prefix-suffix array (LPS).
The answer is the longest prefix that is also a suffix (excluding the whole string).

problems.title: String Matching in an Array (String Algorithm)
problems.description:
Problem Statement

Given an array of string words, return all strings in words that are a substring of another word. You can return the answer in any order.

Return a space-separated string of all matching words. If no matches found, return empty string.
problems.examples:
Sample Input
mass as hero superhero

Sample Output
as hero

Explanation: "as" is substring of "mass" and "hero" is substring of "superhero".

Sample Input
leetcode et code

Sample Output
et code

Explanation: "et", "code" are substring of "leetcode".
problems.constraints:
1 <= words.length <= 100
1 <= words[i].length <= 30
words[i] contains only lowercase English letters.
All the strings of words are unique.
hintsList: For each word, check if it is a substring of any other word.
Use string matching functions to check substring relationships.

problems.title: Check if a Word Occurs as a Prefix of Any Word in a Sentence (String Algorithm)
problems.description:
Problem Statement

Given a sentence that consists of some words separated by a single space, and a searchWord, check if searchWord is a prefix of any word in sentence.
Return the index of the word in sentence (1-indexed) where searchWord is a prefix of this word. If searchWord is a prefix of more than one word, return the index of the first word (minimum index). If there is no such word return -1.
A prefix of a string s is any leading contiguous substring of s.
problems.examples:
Sample Input
i love eating burger
burg

Sample Output
4

Explanation: "burg" is prefix of "burger" which is the 4th word in the sentence.

Sample Input
this problem is an easy problem
pro

Sample Output
2

Explanation: "pro" is prefix of "problem" which is the 2nd and the 6th word in the sentence, but we return 2 as it's the minimal index.
problems.constraints:
1 <= sentence.length <= 100
1 <= searchWord.length <= 10
sentence consists of lowercase English letters and spaces.
searchWord consists of lowercase English letters.

testCases.input:
this problem is an easy problem
pro

starterCodes.code:
class Solution:
    def isPrefixOfWord(self, sentence, searchWord):
        # TODO: Return the 1-indexed word position or -1
        pass

if __name__ == '__main__':
    import sys
    lines = sys.stdin.read().strip().split('\n')
    sentence = lines[0] if len(lines) > 0 else ""
    searchWord = lines[1] if len(lines) > 1 else ""
    sol = Solution()
    print(sol.isPrefixOfWord(sentence, searchWord))

hintsList: Split the sentence into words.
Check if searchWord is a prefix of each word using string comparison.

problems.title: Maximum Repeating Substring (String Algorithm)
problems.description:
Problem Statement

For a string sequence, a string word is k-repeating if word concatenated k times is a substring of sequence. The word's maximum k-repeating value is the highest value k where word is k-repeating in sequence. If word is not a substring of sequence, word's maximum k-repeating value is 0.
Given strings sequence and word, return the maximum k-repeating value of word in sequence.
problems.examples:
Sample Input
ababc
ab

Sample Output
2

Explanation: "abab" is a substring in "ababc".

Sample Input
ababc
ba

Sample Output
1

Explanation: "ba" is a substring in "ababc". "baba" is not a substring in "ababc".
problems.constraints:
1 <= sequence.length <= 100
1 <= word.length <= 100
sequence and word contains only lowercase English letters.

starterCodes.code:
class Solution:
    def maxRepeating(self, sequence, word):
        # TODO: Return maximum k-repeating value
        pass

if __name__ == '__main__':
    import sys
    lines = sys.stdin.read().strip().split('\n')
    sequence = lines[0] if len(lines) > 0 else ""
    word = lines[1] if len(lines) > 1 else ""
    sol = Solution()
    print(sol.maxRepeating(sequence, word))

hintsList: Try increasing values of k and check if word repeated k times is a substring.
Stop when the repeated word is no longer found in the sequence.

problems.title: Counting Words with a Given Prefix (String Algorithm)
problems.description:
Problem Statement

You are given an array of strings words and a string pref.
Return the number of strings in words that contain pref as a prefix.
A prefix of a string s is any leading contiguous substring of s.
problems.examples:
Sample Input
pay attention practice attend
at

Sample Output
2

Explanation: The 2 strings that contain "at" as a prefix are: "attention" and "attend".

Sample Input
leetcode win loops success
code

Sample Output
0

Explanation: There are no strings that contain "code" as a prefix.
problems.constraints:
1 <= words.length <= 100
1 <= words[i].length, pref.length <= 100
words[i] and pref consist of lowercase English letters.

starterCodes.code:
class Solution:
    def prefixCount(self, words, pref):
        # TODO: Return count of words with prefix
        pass

if __name__ == '__main__':
    import sys
    lines = sys.stdin.read().strip().split('\n')
    words = lines[0].split() if len(lines) > 0 else []
    pref = lines[1] if len(lines) > 1 else ""
    sol = Solution()
    print(sol.prefixCount(words, pref))

hintsList: Iterate through each word and check if it starts with the prefix.
Use string comparison functions to check if a word has the given prefix.
